column4: hi : ) used umount /dev/sdb1 to umount my usb so i can use mkfs.vfat to format it.  comes back with sdb1 not in fstab how do i force an unmount?
umount where your usb drive is mounted to
oh haha itz mounted to media
hey actually my usb is not showing up in fstab
see if it's mounted by typing mount
fstab is useful when you want something to mount at boot or if you just want to do mount <device> it will mount to whatever you have it being mounted to in your fstab
cool cool thx for the expl im just learning dis
here is wut i have from mount
k you want to to use sudo unless your root already sudo umount /dev/sdb1 or umount /media/MEMOREXTD
